subject: p19150427
History: History of pneumonia, evaluation for pulmonary edema.
Findings: As compared to the previous radiograph, the lung volumes have decreased. There are new bilateral small pleural effusions and areas of bilateral parenchymal opacities at the lung bases. These changes are suggestive of atelectasis rather than pneumonia, given the symmetry of the appearance. However, close monitoring with radiographs should be performed. An apparent enlargement of the aortic knob is caused by the change in the patients head position. However, this change should also be received close attention on radiographic monitoring to be performed in the next hours. At the time of dictation and observation, 9:28 am, on, the referring physician,. , was paged for notification.
